page.title: 14RELIGION IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: The parish church dedicated to St Andrew was probably started in 1229 when Hugh de Northwold,a native of the village,was consecrated Bishop of Ely. The most important feature is the Easter Sepulchre,beautifully carved from local chalk stone and reputed to be the finest in the country.There is a peal of 8 bells,also a set of handbells.Since 1981 there has been no resident Rector,the parish being combined with Methwold. Holy Communion is held on the first and third Sundays of the month;Holy Communion with Matins on the second and fourth Sundays;combined services with Methwold on the fifth Sunday; Evensong on the first and third Sundays in Summer. Methodist worshippers attend services in Methwold as both chapels in Northwold are now closed.
